# Kevin O'Connell Trade Status: Resolution Analysis

The Minnesota Vikings and head coach Kevin O'Connell agreed to a multi-year contract extension on January 21, 2025, effectively removing him from the final year of his original deal and securing his position with the franchise[15][17]. This extension followed weeks of speculation fueled by reports from NFL insiders like Jay Glazer, who indicated multiple teams had expressed interest in trading for O'Connell[1][4][7]. However, the Vikings consistently denied any intention to trade their head coach, with a team source stating emphatically, *"We love Kevin and there will be no trade"*[16]. O'Connell himself publicly affirmed his commitment to Minnesota, stating, *"This is where I want to be"*[5][8]. 

By the resolution deadline of March 12, 2025, at 4:00 PM ET, no credible reports or official announcements indicated a trade had occurred. The Vikings' focus shifted to offseason roster moves, including quarterback decisions involving J.J. McCarthy and free agent acquisitions[12][13]. Given the contractual resolution in January and the absence of subsequent trade activity, this market conclusively resolves to **No**.
